columns.ID: The unique identifier for each swimmer.
columns.name: The name of the swimmer.
columns.meter_100: The time taken to swim 100 meters.
columns.meter_200: The time taken to swim 200 meters.
columns.meter_300: The time taken to swim 300 meters.
columns.meter_400: The time taken to swim 400 meters.
columns.meter_500: The time taken to swim 500 meters.
columns.meter_600: The time taken to swim 600 meters.
columns.meter_700: The time taken to swim 700 meters.
columns.Time: The total time taken for all events.

swimmer.table_description: The table stores information about swimmers and their event times.

columns.ID: The unique identifier for each event.
columns.Name: The name of the swimming event.
columns.Stadium_ID: The identifier for the stadium hosting the event.
columns.Year: The year the event is held.

event.table_description: The table tracks swimming events and their details.

columns.ID: The unique identifier for each record of results.
columns.Result: The outcome of the swimmer in the event.
columns.Swimmer_ID: The identifier of the swimmer linked to the record.
columns.Event_ID: The identifier of the event associated with the record.

record.table_description: The table tracks results for swimmers in different events.

columns.ID: The unique identifier for each stadium.
columns.name: The name of the stadium.
columns.Capacity: The maximum number of spectators the stadium can hold.
columns.City: The city where the stadium is located.
columns.Country: The country where the stadium is situated.
columns.Opening_year: The year the stadium was opened.

stadium.table_description: The table provides details about various stadiums used in events.
